result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy McKinney

records.addlTxt: Racine County Alternatives Program

9:59 AM Defendant Jeremy McKinney in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Jeremy McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
State moves to modify bond back to original bond.
Defense makes argument.
BTC: Motion by the State to increase bond denied.
Bail/bond hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.
for DeNovo Review of Bond by the State.
NG plea entered.

BTC: Bond Modification granted to $3,000 cash bond. Same Conditions

As to 21CF1122:
Defense has no objections to State's MIL.
Defense needs to discuss Miranda/Goodchild, has been having issues seeing defendant in the jail.
BTC: Defense to speak with defendant and let the Court and State know by Tuesday next week if Miranda/Goodchild hearing is needed.  Case 20CF1122 will be the 1st trial and if that case does not go then 21CF440 will go to trial.

1:38 PM Defendant Jeremy McKinney appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
Defendant asking for lower cash bond so he can hire his own attorney.
State objects
BTC: Denied bond modification. Set on Judge's calendar to see if Attorney Preston is taking this case.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Jeremy McKinney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Jeremy McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Atty Ramirez appears as a friend of the court. 
Clerk indicates Atty Preston is appointed on the other files. 
Atty Ramirez indicates he will look into why Atty Preston has not been appointed at this time. 
Defendant wishes to address bond today. 
BTC: Court will not address bond today but will review at the next date.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
